reviews.title: Great Location but...
reviews.text: this is not a 3* hotel. It was a good base for exploring Milan. Close to the Central Station, Metro and trams. Unhelpful Staff. "ask at Tourist Information" was the answer to everything! Rooms OK but noisy airconditioning. Breakfast not worth getting up for. U even have to pay an extra euro for an eggcupful of fresh orange juice! Stayed in room and had a lovely cup of tea made with good old British teabags! We didnt pay very much for our stay so we were quite pleased at this. This hotel didnt spoil our great weekend. Visit the Navigli area. U won't be disappointed. Direct line from Central Station on the Metro

reviews.title: Not recommended
reviews.text: Stayed in nazioni for 4 nights in late june. This is a low graded 3 star hotel. The lobby is acceptably decorated, but just for mimicking its old rooms. We had 1 quad and 1 triple room, both have dim lights and uncomfortable beds. luckily we were so tired to sleep. one air-conditioner had noise when working. the fridge is not a fridge. no water boiler --> we asked the receptionist and was told to ask bar, the rude staff there gave us a tiny pot of hot water, only told us it costs 2EUROS when asked!! rip-off!!

reviews.title: Look elsewhere!
reviews.text: Some receptionists are helpful, but some of them are rude. They are english speaking.

reviews.title: Find an Alternative
reviews.text: post office is opposite, but staff dont speak english.
5-10 mins walk to centrale metro station, which many coachs serve directly from linate malpensa and bergarmo airports.
reviews.title: DEFINITELY NOT 3 STARS! WHAT A DUMP!
Acceptable if you get a good internet rate
reviews.text: I originally booked just one night on a discount booking site. When I arrived at the hotel, I was informed that there had been a "plumbing emergency" and they were moving me to a comparable hotel a few blocks away. (I was escorted there but dragged my bag myself.) The other hotel was older and slightly run down (as was the gruff hotel clerk), but at least had a fairly decent breakfast. I tried the delle Tulipe on my return to Milan and was given a room there. The single room was very small (which is fine with me) but quiet and easily accessible by the small elevator. The breakfast was as mingy as the other reviews have mentioned, but acceptable. I would stay there again because of its relative convenience to the central train station, but only if I received a discounted rate.

reviews.title: bedsit meets prison
reviews.text: Do not stay here, even if they pay you....You have been warned!
Ciao!
reviews.title: One star too much given!
Good place to stay
reviews.text: I have been in Milan for five times in the last half year (because of a proejct). On my second trip I stayed in Delle Nazioni. I took Nazioni because of the photos and of course the price.
It is located near main station. Many good and cheap restaurants and bars are around. Thats all good I have to say.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Enjoyed every minute of it
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay in the Tulip Inn. Ok the rooms were not great but the bed was comfortable and meybe the rooms were cramped they were clean. What more could you ask for. Nobody goes to Milan to spend all day in their rooms anyway.
The breakfast was basic but that is what Itallians eat in the mornings. You may have had to pay for the orange juice but nobody forces you to.
reviews.title: Good
It could be worse than that!!
reviews.text: I had a great stay in the Hotel and met some really nice people. On my next visit to Milan I will be staying at the Hotel.
Pros: -The staff spoke English and were very friendly
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: -The beds were very comfortable
reviews.title: Not recommended (at all!)
Good Location
reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location for sightseeing and shopping.

reviews.title: Close to the train and confortable bed
reviews.text: The hotel is basic so dont expect the ritz.

reviews.title: the honeymooner
reviews.text: Our room had not been refurbished as some in the hotel have but it was perfectly clean and all you need for a mid priced hotel.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Milan is a fantastic city ideal for shopping and the museums and tourist attractions are excellent value for money.

reviews.title: Think again is right
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights and got good sleep as the street is quiet.
